prompt:
Generate an HTML page using vtk.js to visualize the Redsea dataset with volume rendering._x000d_
_x000d_
Load the dataset from: http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/redsea.vti_x000d_
_x000d_
Compute velocity magnitude from the "velocity" array and set it as the active scalar_x000d_
_x000d_
Apply volume rendering using a blue → white → red color map spanning the scalar range (min to max)_x000d_
_x000d_
Apply a piecewise opacity function to control transparency across scalar values_x000d_
_x000d_
Set shading, ambient, diffuse, and specular properties for realistic volume appearance_x000d_
_x000d_
Adjust the camera to look along +Z and center on the dataset
ground_truth:
_x000d_ _x000d_ _x000d_ _x000d_ _x000d_ _x000d_ redsea Example_x000d_ _x000d_ _x000d_ _x000d_ _x000d_
_x000d_ _x000d_ _x000d_ _x000d_ _x000d_
generator_prompt:
You are a VTK.js visualization expert. Based on the user's requirements and the provided VTK.js examples, generate complete and functional HTML code that meets all specified requirements.
    Please follow these guidelines:
    1. Generate complete HTML code that can run independently
    2. Use the VTK.js library from CDN (https://unpkg.com/vtk.js@34.10.0/vtk.js)
    3. Implement ALL requirements specified in the user question
    4. Add detailed comments explaining how each requirement is implemented
    5. Ensure the visualization is displayed properly without UI controls unless specifically requested
    6. Pay special attention to data loading paths and visualization parameters
    7. The data format for generating code is vti format, please use the correct IO module,The system reading method does not support HttpDatasetReader. Please use another appropriate module, such as vtkXMLImageDataReader
    Important: Highlight in comments how each specific user requirement is addressed in the code.
evaluator_prompt:
# Role

You are an expert Evaluator for vtk.js and web-based scientific visualization. Your task is to compare the [GENERATED_CODE] against the [GROUND_TRUTH] and evaluate it based on specific dimensions.

# Input Data

## Ground Truth Code:

[GROUND_TRUTH]

## Generated Code:

[GENERATED_CODE]

# Evaluation Criteria & Rubric (0.0 to 1.0)

Please evaluate the generated code based on the following 3 dimensions. 

1. **Functionality & Completeness (Task Completion)**: 
   - Does the code implement the same visualization pipeline as the ground truth? (e.g., correct readers, mappers, filters).
   - Are critical elements present (e.g., color transfer functions, full-screen rendering)?
   - Score 1.0 if logic is identical; lower if steps are missing.

2. **Visual Fidelity (Visual Quality)**:
   - Based on the code logic, will the visual output look similar to the ground truth?
   - Check camera parameters, background colors, and opacity transfer functions.
   - Check if the correct data arrays (scalars/vectors) are selected for coloring.

3. **Code Quality & Maintainability**:
   - Is the code readable, well-structured, and using vtk.js best practices?
   - Is the variable naming clear?

# Response Format

You must output the evaluation in the following Strict XML format. Do not use Markdown block quotes.

<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>[AVERAGE_SCORE]</OverallScore>
        <Critique>[ONE_SENTENCE_SUMMARY]</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

evaluator_evaluation.evaluator_evaluation:
<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>0.9</Score>
        <Reason>The generated code implements the same core pipeline: loading a VTI dataset, computing velocity magnitude, setting it as active scalars, and rendering with volume mapper and actor. It uses vtkCalculator instead of manual array creation, which is valid. However, it omits setting spacing explicitly (ground truth sets imageData.setSpacing(0.05, 0.05, 0.1)), which may affect sampling and visual scale. Also, LAO properties (LAOKernelSize, etc.) are not replicated exactly—instead, LAO is disabled via mapper.setLocalAmbientOcclusion(0), but ground truth configures LAO parameters even if disabled. Minor functional divergence.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>0.85</Score>
        <Reason>Color transfer function matches (blue-white-red). Opacity function is similar but uses slightly different control points (e.g., 0.1 vs 0.05 at 10% range). Shading is enabled in generated code (setShade(true)) while ground truth disables it (setShade(false)), leading to potentially different lighting appearance. Background is black ([0,0,0]) vs white ([1,1,1]) in ground truth, affecting contrast. Camera positioning logic is equivalent, so view alignment is preserved.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>0.95</Score>
        <Reason>Code is well-structured, uses clear variable names, and leverages vtk.js best practices like vtkCalculator for derived arrays. Comments explain key steps and requirements. Uses modern fetch API instead of reader.setUrl(), which is acceptable and more explicit. Minor inconsistency: imports vtkFullScreenRenderWindow.newInstance but then calls it as a function without .newInstance (though this works due to how vtk.js exports). Overall highly readable and maintainable.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>0.9</OverallScore>
        <Critique>The generated code closely replicates the ground truth's functionality and visual intent with minor deviations in shading, background color, opacity curve, and missing explicit spacing, but demonstrates excellent code quality and correct use of vtk.js patterns.</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

Functionality.reason: The generated code implements the same core pipeline: loading a VTI dataset, computing velocity magnitude, setting it as active scalars, and rendering with volume mapper and actor. It uses vtkCalculator instead of manual array creation, which is valid. However, it omits setting spacing explicitly (ground truth sets imageData.setSpacing(0.05, 0.05, 0.1)), which may affect sampling and visual scale. Also, LAO properties (LAOKernelSize, etc.) are not replicated exactly—instead, LAO is disabled via mapper.setLocalAmbientOcclusion(0), but ground truth configures LAO parameters even if disabled. Minor functional divergence.

VisualQuality.reason: Color transfer function matches (blue-white-red). Opacity function is similar but uses slightly different control points (e.g., 0.1 vs 0.05 at 10% range). Shading is enabled in generated code (setShade(true)) while ground truth disables it (setShade(false)), leading to potentially different lighting appearance. Background is black ([0,0,0]) vs white ([1,1,1]) in ground truth, affecting contrast. Camera positioning logic is equivalent, so view alignment is preserved.

CodeQuality.reason: Code is well-structured, uses clear variable names, and leverages vtk.js best practices like vtkCalculator for derived arrays. Comments explain key steps and requirements. Uses modern fetch API instead of reader.setUrl(), which is acceptable and more explicit. Minor inconsistency: imports vtkFullScreenRenderWindow.newInstance but then calls it as a function without .newInstance (though this works due to how vtk.js exports). Overall highly readable and maintainable.

parsed_evaluation.critique: The generated code closely replicates the ground truth's functionality and visual intent with minor deviations in shading, background color, opacity curve, and missing explicit spacing, but demonstrates excellent code quality and correct use of vtk.js patterns.

analysis.description: Load the Redsea dataset from 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/redsea.vti' using vtkXMLImageDataReader.
Use vtkCalculator to compute the magnitude of the 'velocity' vector array and set the resulting scalar array as the active scalar for the dataset.

Set up volume rendering with vtkVolumeMapper and vtkVolumeActor. Create a blue → white → red color transfer function spanning the full scalar range of the velocity magnitude. Define a piecewise opacity function to control transparency across scalar values.
Enable shading on the volume property and configure ambient, diffuse, and specular coefficients to achieve a realistic appearance.
Initialize the renderer, render window, and interactor. Position the camera to look along the +Z axis and center it on the dataset bounds before rendering.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-VolumeClip\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Renders a 3D medical volume (`headsq.vti`) with a clipping plane, using `vtkVolumeMapper` and `vtkVolumeActor` for customized appearance.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Rendering-VolumeMapper\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Loads a 3D volume dataset and renders it using `vtkVolumeActor` and `vtkVolumeMapper` with extensive customization for appearance and quality.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-Calculator\code.html
retrieval_results.description: This code visualizes a 3D plane colored by a mathematical function, using `vtkCalculator` for scalar values and `vtkMapper` for coloring.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Filter-ImageLabelOutline\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Displays a 2D image volume with an outlined labelmap. Specific regions (high/low values) are highlighted in red/green with transparent outlines.

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\IO-StickMapper\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Generates a plane and uses `vtkCalculator` to create custom point data ('orientation', 'temperature', 'pressure'), which `vtkStickMapper` could use for rendering (currently not fully connected).

retrieval_results.title: data\vtkjs-examples\prompt-sample\Rendering-GlyphMapper\code.html
retrieval_results.description: Visualizes a 3D plane with glyphs (e.g., cones) whose scale and orientation are based on scalar and vector data, using `vtkGlyph3DMapper` and `vtkCalculator`.
